quotes.quote: This was the best date I’d ever been on. And it wasn’t even a date.
Love is blind friendship closes its eyes.
The friend becomes a traitor by breaking, however unwillingly or sadly, out of our own zone. A hard judgement is passed on him, for all the pleas of the heart.
Should I smile because we are friends? Or cry because we'll never be anything more?
Always a boyfriend, never a boyfriend.

Even now I'll see her looking at him, her eyes milky yet full of longing, and all he ever gives her is a gentle, absent nod. Perhaps this is the nature of true deprivation a lifetime of love, tenderly spurned.
There is boy friend and then there is boyfriend that tiny little space is known as the friend zone. Dont get it twisted.
I've often liked a girl, made her laugh, and thought she liked me, and then found out that she didn't like me that way. I've definitely done time in the friend zone.

The heart may think it knows better: the senses know that absence blots people out. We really have no absent friends. The friend becomes a traitor by breaking, however unwillingly or sadly, out of our own zone: a hard judgment is passed on him, for all the pleas of the heart.
I think once you're in the friend zone, I'm not sure how you get out. Well, actually, I do know how you get out. You act like the friend back. That's how you get out.
